results.question: Which scholars won Physics in 1921?
results.answer: Albert Einstein won the Physics Nobel Prize in 1921.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear = 1921
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Which prizes were awarded in 1922?
results.answer: The prizes awarded in 1922 were in Medicine, Chemistry, and Physics.
results.cypher: MATCH (p:Prize) WHERE p.awardYear = 1922 RETURN p.category AS category, p.awardYear AS year

results.question: Which scholars won Chemistry prizes in 2000?
results.answer: The scholars who won Chemistry prizes in 2000 are Hideki Shirakawa, Alan MacDiarmid, and Alan Heeger.
results.cypher: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize {awardYear: 2000}) WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear

results.question: Which prizes were awarded in 1922?
results.answer: The prizes awarded in 1922 were in Medicine, Chemistry, and Physics.
results.cypher: MATCH (p:Prize) WHERE p.awardYear = 1922 RETURN p.category AS prize_category, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Which scholars were born in Paris?

Cournand, Irène Joliot-Curie, Jacques Monod, Maurice Allais, Charles Richet, Pierre Curie, Françoise Barré-Sinoussi, Henri Becquerel, Frédéric Joliot, and Henri Moissan.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City)
WHERE toLower(c.name) = 'paris'
RETURN s.knownName

results.question: Which scholars won Nobel Prizes in Physics after 1990?
results.answer: Pierre-Gilles de Gennes won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1991, Georges Charpak in 1992, Joseph H. Taylor Jr. and Russell A. Hulse in 1993, Bertram N. Brockhouse and Clifford G. Shull in 1994, Frederick Reines and Martin L. Perl in 1995, David M. Lee, Robert C. Richardson, and Douglas D. Osheroff in 1996, Claude Cohen-Tannoudji, Steven Chu, and William D. Phillips in 1997, Daniel C. Tsui, Robert B. Laughlin, and Horst L. Störmer in 1998, Martinus J.G. Veltman and Gerardus 't Hooft in 1999, Jack Kilby, Zhores Alferov, George A. Akerlof, Herbert Kroemer, A. Michael Spence, and Joseph E. Stiglitz in 2000, Carl Wieman, Wolfgang Ketterle, and Eric Cornell in 2001, Masatoshi Koshiba and Raymond Davis Jr. in 2002, Riccardo Giacconi in 2002, Anthony J. Leggett in 2003, Vitaly L. Ginzburg, Alexei Abrikosov, and David J. Gross in 2003, H. David Politzer, Frank Wilczek, and David J. Gross in 2004, John L. Hall and Theodor W. Hänsch in 2005, Roy J. Glauber in 2005, George F. Smoot and John C. Mather in 2006, Albert Fert and Peter Grünberg in 2007, Makoto Kobayashi, Toshihide Maskawa, and Yoichiro Nambu in 2008, Charles K. Kao, Willard S. Boyle, and George E. Smith in 2009, Andre Geim and Konstantin Novoselov in 2010, Adam G. Riess, Saul Perlmutter, and Brian P. Schmidt in 2011, Serge Haroche and David J. Wineland in 2012, Peter Higgs and Françoise Englert in 2013, Hiroshi Amano, Isamu Akasaki, and Shuji Nakamura in 2014, Arthur B. McDonald and Takaaki Kajita in 2015, David J. Thouless, F. Duncan M. Haldane, and J. Michael Kosterlitz in 2016, Barry C. Barish, Rainer Weiss, and Kip S. Thorne in 2017, Gérard Mourou, Arthur Ashkin, and Donna Strickland in 2018, James Peebles in 2019, Michel Mayor and Didier Queloz in 2019, Andrea Ghez in 2020, Roger Penrose in 2020, Reinhard Genzel in 2020, Klaus Hasselmann in 2021, Giorgio Parisi in 2021, Syukuro Manabe in 2021, Anton Zeilinger, Alain Aspect, and John Clauser in 2022.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear > 1990
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, p.awardYear AS award_year ORDER BY p.awardYear

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with an institution in Germany died between the years 1935 and 1945?
results.answer:
The scholars affiliated with an institution in Germany who died between 1935 and 1945 are:

1. Carl Bosch, who died on 1940-04-26 at I.G. Farbenindustrie A.G. and University of Heidelberg.
2. Hans Fischer, who died on 1945-03-31 at Technische Hochschule (Institute of Technology).
3. Richard Willstätter, who died on 1942-08-03 at Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität and Kaiser-Wilhelm-Institut (now Max-Planck Institut) für Chemie.
4. Walther Nernst, who died on 1941-11-18 at Berlin University.
5. Hans Spemann, who died on 1941-09-12 at University of Freiburg im Breisgau.
6. Richard Willstätter (repeated), who died on 1942-08-03 at Kaiser-Wilhelm-Institut (now Max-Planck Institut) für Chemie.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)
WHERE toLower(co.name) = 'germany' AND s.deathDate >= '1935-01-01' AND s.deathDate <= '1945-12-31'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName AS ScholarName, i.name AS InstitutionName, s.deathDate AS DeathDate

results.question: Which scholars won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1933?
results.answer: The scholars who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1933 are Paul A.M. Dirac and Erwin Schrödinger.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear = 1933
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Who are the female laureates in Physics?
results.answer: The female laureates in Physics are Maria Goeppert Mayer, Donna Strickland, Andrea Ghez, and Marie Curie.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND toLower(s.gender) = 'female'
RETURN s.knownName AS laureate, p.category AS category, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Which scholars born in France won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry?
results.answer: The scholars born in France who won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry are Frédéric Joliot in 1935, Henri Moissan in 1906, Irène Joliot-Curie in 1935, Jean-Pierre Sauvage in 2016, and Luis Leloir in 1970.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) 
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' AND p.awardYear IS NOT NULL
MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)
WHERE toLower(co.name) CONTAINS 'france'
RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear, co.name AS BirthCountry

results.question: Which Physics laureates were affiliated with an institution in Denmark?
results.answer: The Physics laureates affiliated with an institution in Denmark are Ben R. Mottelson, Niels Bohr, and Aage N. Bohr.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics'
MATCH (s)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(d:Country)
WHERE toLower(d.name) = 'denmark'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.awardYear, i.name AS InstitutionName

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with Stanford University won a prize in 1996?
results.answer: No information found in the database.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution), (s)-[:WON {portion: '*' }]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'stanford' AND p.awardYear = 1996
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName AS scholar, p.category AS prize_category, i.name AS institution

results.question: Which scholars won the Nobel Prize in Economics in 2019?
results.answer: The scholars who won the Nobel Prize in Economics in 2019 are Esther Duflo, Abhijit Banerjee, and Michael Kremer.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'economics' AND p.awardYear = 2019
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with Harvard University won the Medicine prize?
results.answer: The scholars affiliated with Harvard University who won the Medicine prize are George R. Minot, William P. Murphy, Konrad Bloch, George Wald, and James Watson.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution), (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'harvard' AND toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'medicine'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.awardYear, i.name AS Institution

results.question: Who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2020?
results.answer: The Nobel Prize in Physics in 2020 was won by Andrea Ghez, Roger Penrose, and Reinhard Genzel.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear = 2020
RETURN s.knownName AS winner, p.category AS category, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics'
MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City) WHERE toLower(c.name) CONTAINS 'new york'
RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear, c.name AS BirthCity

results.question: Which female scholars won the Nobel Prize in Medicine?
results.answer: The female scholars who won the Nobel Prize in Medicine are Carol W. Greider in 2009, Rosalyn Yalow in 1977, Tu Youyou in 2015, Barbara McClintock in 1983, May-Britt Moser in 2014, Gerty Cori in 1947, Rita Levi-Montalcini in 1986, Linda B. Buck in 2004, Françoise Barré-Sinoussi in 2008, Gertrude B. Elion in 1988, Elizabeth H. Blackburn in 2009, and Christiane Nüsslein-Volhard in 1995.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(s.gender) = 'female' AND toLower(p.category) = 'medicine'
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with an institution in France won the Economics prize?
results.answer: The scholars affiliated with an institution in France who won the Economics prize are Jean Tirole and Maurice Allais. Jean Tirole won the prize in 2014 while affiliated with the Toulouse School of Economics (TSE), and Maurice Allais won the prize in 1988 while affiliated with \u00c9cole Nationale Sup\u00e9rieur des Mines de Paris.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country) 
MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(co.name) CONTAINS 'france' AND toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'economics'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName AS ScholarName, p.awardYear AS PrizeYear, i.name AS InstitutionName

context.InstitutionName: École Nationale Supérieur des Mines de Paris

results.question: Which scholars won a prize with a 1/3 share portion?
results.answer:
The scholars who won a prize with a 1/3 share portion include:

- Andrew Huxley

results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[r:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(r.portion) = '1/3'

results.question: Which institutions in Japan have been affiliated with Physics laureates?
results.answer: The institutions in Japan that have been affiliated with Physics laureates are Meijo University, Kyoto Sangyo University, University of Tokyo, Nagoya University, High Energy Accelerator Research Organization (KEK), Yukawa Institute for Theoretical Physics (YITP), Kyoto University, and Tokyo University of Education.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) 
WHERE toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'physics'
MATCH (s)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)
MATCH (i)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(ci:City)
MATCH (ci)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)
WHERE toLower(co.name) CONTAINS 'japan'
RETURN DISTINCT i.name AS institution

context.institution: Yukawa Institute for Theoretical Physics (YITP), Kyoto University

results.question: Who won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2022?
results.answer: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2022 was won by Carolyn Bertozzi, K. Barry Sharpless, and Morten Meldal.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' AND p.awardYear = 2022
RETURN s.knownName AS winner, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with Columbia University won the Economics prize?
results.answer: The scholars affiliated with Columbia University who won the Economics prize are Robert Mundell in 1999, Edmund S. Phelps in 2006, and William Vickrey in 1996.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) 
WHERE toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'economics'
MATCH (s)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution) 
WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'columbia'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.awardYear, i.name AS Institution

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with Yale University won a prize in Chemistry?
results.answer: The scholars affiliated with Yale University who won a prize in Chemistry are Lars Onsager, who received the award in 1968, Sidney Altman, who received it in 1989, and Thomas A. Steitz, who received it in 2009.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution) WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'yale'
MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry'
RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear, i.name AS Institution

results.question: Who are the scholars affiliated with the University of Chicago who won the Economics prize?
results.answer:
The scholars affiliated with the University of Chicago who won the Economics prize are:

Douglas Diamond (2022), Eugene F. Fama (2013), Gary Becker (1992), George J. Stigler (1982), James J. Heckman (2000), Lars Peter Hansen (2013), Merton H. Miller (1990), Milton Friedman (1976), Richard H. Thaler (2017), Robert E. Lucas Jr. (1995), Robert W. Fogel (1993), Roger B. Myerson (2007), Ronald H. Coase (1991), and Theodore W. Schultz (1979).
results.cypher:
MATCH (scholar:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(inst:Institution) WHERE toLower(inst.name) CONTAINS 'university of chicago'
MATCH (scholar)-[:WON]->(prize:Prize) WHERE toLower(prize.category) CONTAINS 'economics'
RETURN scholar.knownName AS scholar, prize.awardYear AS award_year, inst.name AS institution

results.question: Which scholars won Physiology or Medicine in 1920?
results.answer: August Krogh won Physiology or Medicine in 1920.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'medicine' AND p.awardYear = 1920
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.awardYear

results.answer: No information found in the database.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON {portion: '*'}]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' AND p.awardYear = 2010
RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear

results.answer: No information found in the database.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON {portion: '*'}]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' AND p.awardYear = 1926
RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear

results.answer: No information found in the database.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON {portion: '*' }]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' AND p.awardYear = 1990
RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear

results.question: Which scholars born in Taiwan won the Chemistry prize between 1986 and 1991?
results.answer: No information found in the database.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) 
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' AND p.awardYear >= 1986 AND p.awardYear <= 1991
MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)
WHERE toLower(co.name) CONTAINS 'taiwan'
RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear, co.name AS BirthCountry

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with Institute for Infectious Diseases won a prize in Physiology or Medicine?
results.answer: No information found in the database.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) 
WHERE toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'medicine' AND toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'physiology'
MATCH (s)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution) 
WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'institute for infectious diseases'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.category, p.awardYear, i.name AS Institution

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with CERN won a prize in Physics?
results.answer: The scholars affiliated with CERN who won a prize in Physics are Carlo Rubbia, Jack Steinberger, Simon van der Meer, and Georges Charpak.
results.cypher:
MATCH (scholar:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(inst:Institution), (scholar)-[:WON]->(prize:Prize)
WHERE toLower(inst.name) CONTAINS 'cern' AND toLower(prize.category) CONTAINS 'physics'
WITH scholar, prize, inst, prize.awardYear AS award_year, prize.category AS prize_category
MATCH (inst)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(city:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(country:Country)
RETURN scholar.knownName AS scholar, award_year, prize_category, country.name AS country

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with University of Oxford won a prize in Chemistry?
results.answer: The scholars affiliated with the University of Oxford who won a prize in Chemistry are Frederick Soddy in 1921, Sir Cyril Hinshelwood in 1956, Sir Robert Robinson in 1947, and Dorothy Crowfoot Hodgkin in 1964.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution), 
      (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'university of oxford' 
  AND toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'chemistry'
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, p.awardYear AS award_year, i.name AS institution

results.question: Which scholars were born in Pretoria?
results.answer: The scholars born in Pretoria are Michael Levitt and Max Theiler.
results.cypher: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:BORN_IN]->(ci:City) WHERE toLower(ci.name) = 'pretoria' RETURN s.knownName AS scholar

results.question: Which scholars were born in Turin?
results.answer: The scholars born in Turin are Rita Levi-Montalcini and Salvador E. Luria.
results.cypher: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:BORN_IN]->(ci:City) WHERE toLower(ci.name) = 'turin' RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, ci.name AS birth_city

results.question: Which scholars born in Switzerland won the Physics prize between 1980 and 2020?
results.answer: The scholars born in Switzerland who won the Physics prize between 1980 and 2020 are Didier Queloz, K. Alex Müller, and Michel Mayor. Didier Queloz and Michel Mayor won in 2019, while K. Alex Müller won in 1987.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) 
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear >= 1980 AND p.awardYear <= 2020
MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)
WHERE (toLower(co.name) CONTAINS 'switzerland' OR toLower(co.name) CONTAINS 'swiss confederation')
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: How many female scholars won a Nobel Prize between 1980 and 2000?
results.answer: Between 1980 and 2000, there were 4 female scholars who won a Nobel Prize.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(s.gender) = 'female' AND p.awardYear >= 1980 AND p.awardYear <= 2000
RETURN count(DISTINCT s) as female_laureates

results.question: Which scholars have won more than one Nobel Prize?
results.answer: The scholars who have won more than one Nobel Prize are Frederick Sanger, Linus Pauling, Marie Curie, K. Barry Sharpless, and John Bardeen.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WITH s, COUNT(p) AS prize_count
WHERE prize_count > 1
RETURN s.knownName

results.question: How many Physics laureates were born in Paris?
results.answer: The Physics laureates born in Paris are 3.
results.cypher: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City) WHERE toLower(c.name) CONTAINS 'paris' RETURN count(s) as physics_laureates

results.question: How many scholars won a prize with a 1/3 share portion?
results.answer: 221 scholars won a prize with a 1/3 share portion.
results.cypher: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[r:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(r.portion) = '1/3' RETURN count(DISTINCT s) as scholars_with_third_share
